DataElement.preferredName: Fractionation Radiation Therapy Administered Dose UOM
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure that represents a determinate amount or quantity of the dose per fraction of radiation that was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which the total dose delivered is divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a unit of measurement corresponding to a dose of radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one millionth of a curie or 37 kilobecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 000 atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one millionth of a curie or 37 kilobecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 000 atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radiation absorbed dose equal to the amount of energy from any type of ionizing radiation (e.g., alpha, beta, gamma, neutrons, etc.) deposited in any medium (e.g., water, tissue, air). A dose of one rad means the absorption of 100 ergs per gram of absorbing tissue (100 rad = 1 gray). (The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission, NRC).

Concepts.definition: A unit of radiation absorbed dose equal to the amount of energy from any type of ionizing radiation (e.g., alpha, beta, gamma, neutrons, etc.) deposited in any medium (e.g., water, tissue, air). A dose of one rad means the absorption of 100 ergs per gram of absorbing tissue (100 rad = 1 gray). (The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission, NRC).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping
